channel.title: Commands
channel.description:
My acount don't run no commands , its my own server , im running it , but none of the commands work for giving items ...
iv tryed
::item + ::pickup
and yes i do the id and everything correctly ....
is it anything to do with no scripts running on my server???
if yes what do i do ....
-sere

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @new2servers new2servers
item.description:
@new2servers wrote:

put it in client.java and search a command that you know you already have using the find feature. then paste it under it

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @sereton sereton
item.description:
@sereton wrote:

Where do I put in

‘if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);’

and also most of the files i cant edit …

what program do i need for .dat ?

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @new2servers new2servers
item.description:
@new2servers wrote:

if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);

use that and put it near all the other commands

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“new2servers, post:3, topic:345769”]go into client.java and search “pickup” make sure theres a command for it

keep searching pickup till you find somthin like that (mine only had onpickup idk why)

if you dont have it then look for the code somewhere

if(command.startsWith(“onpickup”) && playerRights > 0 || command.startsWith(“pickupon”) && playerRights > 0){
yell("["+playerName+"] - picking up items enabled");
server.pickup = true;[/quote]

i don’t think thats what hes after. i think hes after the pickup spawning code.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @sereton sereton
item.description:
@sereton wrote:

[quote=“new2servers, post:3, topic:345769”]go into client.java and search “pickup” make sure theres a command for it

keep searching pickup till you find somthin like that (mine only had onpickup idk why)

if you dont have it then look for the code somewhere

if(command.startsWith(“onpickup”) && playerRights > 0 || command.startsWith(“pickupon”) && playerRights > 0){
yell("["+playerName+"] - picking up items enabled");
server.pickup = true;[/quote]

I done that but i either done it wrong or its not working … I took away the orginal code that was there and put ‘if(command.startsWith(“onpickup”) && playerRights > 0 || command.startsWith(“pickupon”) && playerRights > 0){
yell("["+playerName+"] - picking up items enabled");
server.pickup = true;’

??

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @new2servers new2servers
item.description:
@new2servers wrote:

go into client.java and search “pickup” make sure theres a command for it

keep searching pickup till you find somthin like that (mine only had onpickup idk why)

if you dont have it then look for the code somewhere

if(command.startsWith(“onpickup”) && playerRights > 0 || command.startsWith(“pickupon”) && playerRights > 0){
yell("["+playerName+"] - picking up items enabled");
server.pickup = true;

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @Epicskillz Epicskillz
item.description:
@Epicskillz wrote:

Some servers are different, and there are many different ways.
Pretend i want 1 gold coin. (Gold = ID 995)

::pickup 0995 1 or ::pickup 00995 1

                  or

::item 0995 1 or ::item 00995 1

Read full topic
